meanings.definition: A white crystalline compound, potassium nitrate, used in gunpowder and fireworks.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers added saltpeter to the gunpowder for the cannons.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was spectacular, thanks to the saltpeter used in the pyrotechnics.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids tried to sneak saltpeter into the school science experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter exploded like saltpeter, lighting up the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The smell of saltpeter lingered in the air after the fireworks show.

meanings.definition: To treat with saltpeter to preserve or cure.
meanings.sent1: The meat was saltpetered to keep it fresh during the long journey.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people would saltpeter food to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: Grandma jokingly threatened to saltpeter the cookies if we didn't stop eating them.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to saltpeter her heart, preserving the memory forever.
meanings.sent5: The old book was carefully saltpetered to prevent further decay.
